qas.question: After the quake, people from where in China made donations?
What caused long lines in most major cities?
What were the Chinese setting up to take in donations?
How did a lot of people donate using mobile phones?
How much had the Chinese government designated by May 16?

context: Following the earthquake, donations were made by people from <a2_0>all over mainland China<a2_0/>, with <a4_0>booths<a4_0/> set up in schools, at banks, and around gas stations. People also <a3_0>donated <a0_0>blood<a3_0/><a0_0/>, resulting in according to Xinhua long line-ups in most major Chinese cities. Many donated through <a5_0>text messaging<a5_0/> on mobile phones to accounts set up by <a1_0>China Unicom and China Mobile<a1_0/> By May 16, the Chinese government had allocated a total of <a6_0>$772 million<a6_0/> for earthquake relief so far, up sharply from $159 million from May 14.
